page.title: 01Farmland East of Alfold Bars
page.content: A rural area with scattered farms and coattages, grazing, mainly for sheep with a few cattle and pockets of arable farming. roughly one-third of the area contains mature indigenous woodlands. Very little rise and fall in vermain. A large part has no arhiculal access, except for tracks and farm roads. The two main roads connect with villages outside the area. The village of Beare Green straddles the main road, with a recent ly closed old village school, a filling station, chapel, social club, pub, public ;playing field and a recent village hall. Part of the village lies ourside the area. There is very little new building and no industry.
